trial_identification.studytitle: Misoprostol versus Oxytocin as prophylaxes against intraoperative and postoperative bleeding in cesarean section
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Misoprostol versus Oxytocin as prophylaxes against intraoperative and postoperative bleeding in cesarean section

interventions.interventions: 600 microgram misoprostol (3 tablets) administrated rectally, right after induction of anesthesia.
interventions.comparator: 10 ml oxytocin infused with 500 cc ringer solution right after clamping of the cord

primaryOutcome.outcome: Intraoperative blood loss during Elective lower segment cesarean sections
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Number and weight differences of towels used intraoperatively

secondaryOutcome.outcome: change in Hemoglobin levels pre and post operative
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measuring blood hemoglobin pre and post operative

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: patients admitted for elective lower segment cesarean section
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: patients with risk factors for postpartum hemorrhage, emergency lower segment cesarean section, or known hypersensitivity to prostaglandins.

trial_design.sequence: Simple Randomization using a randomization table created by a computer software

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Ain Shams university Maternity Hospital, el demerdash Hospitals, El Abassia, Cairo, Egypt.

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 3/A, A.O.I buildings, Makram Ebad St., Nasr City, Cairo, Egypt

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To compare the efficacy of rectally administrated Misoprostol vs. intravenous Oxytocin infusion during and after cesarean sections to control intraoperative and postoperative bleeding.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Ain Shams Maternity Hospital Ethics committee
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Ain Shams Maternity Hospital, Eldemerdash univeristy Hospital, El Abassia, Cairo, Egypt.

contact.name: Amany Sadek
contact.address: 3/A, A.O.I. buildings, Makram Ebad St., Nasr city, Cairo, Egypt.
